column4: Hi, has anybody used "BurnIN Test" [ http://www.passmark.com/products/bit.htm ] - Either way, does anybody know any application like this for a linux system?
Could anybody help me with installing windows drivers on a ubuntu system or point me in the direction of a guide. Thanks in advance
that should work out the box... could you pastebin the output of lspci and lsusb please?
i don't believe ndiswrapper should be needed
pidgin comes by default, but xchat is my personal favourite.
